intro: Erythrodes paranaensis, commonly known as the Parana redwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a broad crown. Due to habitat loss, it is considered an endangered species and is protected in several conservation areas.
